info.description: The public APIs to access event actions and details
info.title: businessProcess

tags.name: eventSteps
tags.description: Returns a collection of business process event steps based on the specified parameters. Only event steps that are awaiting action from the processing person are returned.

tags.name: events
tags.description:
Returns a collection of events based on the specified parameters. You must specify either the worker or initiating worker query parameter. If you did not specify the worker nor the initiating worker parameter, this method returns an empty response. 

This operation returns the most recent results first. The results are sorted in descending order of the creation date of the event.

Secured by the Business Process Security Policy for each event.

tags.name: types
tags.description: Returns all business process types. Secured by Public Business Processes.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

post.summary: Post an action for a To Do step in a business process.
post.description: Post an action for a To Do step in a business process. Specify these required fields in the request body: {stepAction}. You can add an optional comment, if enabled at tenant or business process level. Valid values for stepAction are: { "id": "133d5c88baa64136aab041c1d2e9ed53" } for Submit, { "id": "d9e41d34446c11de98360015c5e6daf6" } for Save for Later. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A212 | This event step isn't awaiting your action
A1572 | Specify a To Do step.
A1573 | You can't comment on this business process type.
A1573 | You can't comment on this business process type.
A1574 | Specify Submit or Save for Later. This step type doesn't support other actions.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of business process event steps. You can filter the event steps by business process, creation date, due date, and step type. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of business process events based on the specified parameters. You must specify exactly one worker parameter. If a worker parameter is not specified, returns a blank response. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves all business process steps that are completed for the specified buinesss process event. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: offset

Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves attachments on the specified business process event that the processing user has permission to view. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable Contains attachment(s)

post.description: Rescinds the business process event specified by the ID. In the request body, specify these required fields: comment. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A181 | You need to specify a comment.
A219 | You can't rescind this event because the status isn't Successfully Completed.
A2443 | You currently don't have security access to rescind this event.
A2444 | You can't rescind this event because this action isn't supported on the business process.
A2444 | You can't rescind this event because this action isn't supported on this business process: [businessprocesstype]
A2445 | You can't rescind this event because this action isn't supported on the subprocess.
A2453 | You can't rescind this event because this event is delegated to someone.
A2454 | You can't rescind this event because there are subevents still in progress.

get.description: Retrieves the business process type specified by the ID. Secured by: Public Business Processes Scope: Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a business process event step.
get.description: Returns a business process event step. Returned results are secured based on processing person's view access to the event to which the step belongs. If the processing person does not have view access to the event, when this API is called, they will not be able to retrieve the event step and receive a 404 error. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves all business process steps that are currently in progress for the specified business process event. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

post.summary: Denies a business process event step.
post.description: Denies the business process event step specified by the ID of the originating event step. The processing person must have view access to the event. In the request body, specify these required fields: id (the event step you are denying), stepAction{id} (if there are multiple event steps), comment. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A181 | A comment is required
A183 | This event step cannot be denied
A212 | This event step is not awaiting your action.
A225 | You are not authorized to deny this event step
A234 | A step action is required when multiple values are available

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. Secured by: Public Business Processes Scope: Tenant Non-Configurable

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

post.summary: Post an action for a Complete Questionnaire step in a business process.
post.description: Post an action for a Complete Questionnaire step in a business process. Specify these required fields in the request body if the intended action is Submit or Save for Later: {stepAction, questionnaireResponse}. You can send Save for Later multiple times, but {questionnaireResponse} values will replace the existing questionnaire answers. If the intended action is Skip, exclude {questionnaireResponse} from the request body. Valid values for stepAction are: { "id": "133d5c88baa64136aab041c1d2e9ed53" } for Submit, { "id": "d9e41a8c446c11de98360015c5e6daf6" } for Save for Later, { "id": "d9e4231a446c11de98360015c5e6daf6" } for Skip. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A212 | This event step isn't awaiting your action
A1584 | Specify a questionnaire response.
A1585 | Specify a complete questionnaire.
A1649 | You can’t skip this step if you provide a questionnaire response.
A1650 | Specify Submit, Save for Later or Skip. This step type doesn't support other actions.
A1651 | This step is required.
A1754 | You have submitted more than one answer for a single select multiple choice question.
A1755 | You have selected an invalid answer choice.
A1757 | This questionnaire is now closed. You can no longer submit new responses or change your existing responses.
A1758 | You cannot submit answers to branching questions without answers for parent questions.
A1759 | All answers you submit must match the expected format for that question type.
A1760 | This questionnaire was submitted already. You can’t submit it again.
A1760 | This questionnaire was submitted already. You can’t submit it again.
A1761 | All answered questions must be questions from the associated questionnaire.
A1762 | Attach an answer. There's no uploaded file.
A1763 | This questionnaire has already been skipped. You can’t submit it again.
A1764 | You must answer all required questions.
A1765 | You have submitted more multiple choice answers than is allowed for a question.

get.summary: Retrieves remaining steps for a business process event.
get.description: Retrieves all remaining business process steps for the specified business process event. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Cancels the business process event specified by the ID. In the request body, specify these required fields: comment. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A181 | You need to specify a comment.
A219 | You can't cancel this business process because the event isn't in progress or in error.
A2198 | You can't cancel this event because this action isn't supported on the subprocess.
A2199 | You can't cancel this event because this action isn't supported on the business process.
A2200 | You can't cancel this event because this action isn't currently supported on the business process.
A2201 | You currently don't have security access to cancel this event.

get.summary: Retrieves attachment categories for a business process type.
get.description: Retrieves all attachment categories for the specified business process type that the processing user can select for the specified event. You can filter by event target. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: eventTarget
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the event target that this business process is about. You can use a returned id from an API that returns instances of the event target type. For example, if your event target is a worker, use GET /workers in the Staffing service.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves the business process event with the specified ID. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Approves a business process event step.
post.description: Approves the business process event step specified by the ID of the originating event step. In the request body, specify these required fields: id (the event step you are approving), comment. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A190 | This event step type cannot be approved
A212 | This event step is not awaiting your action.
A1573 | You can't comment on this business process type.

post.summary: Sends back a business process event step.
post.description: Sends back the business process event step specified by the ID of the originating event step. In the request body, specify these required fields: id (the event step you are sending back), reason. Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes Scope: Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans, Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Tenant Non-Configurable

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A202 | The step you are sending back to isn't supported for this business process.
A212 | This event step isn't awaiting your action
A227 | The step you are sending back from isn't supported for this business process.

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

status_ce00e3198c5b100009273f74aaf20011.description: Transaction status or workflow state for an event. Example: Successfully Completed, Denied, Terminated

initiator_5fd69af0d37810001afef9a3d7684d.description: The \~worker\~ that initiated the business process. Please do not use this field in a condition rule for the initiation step of a process, as it will not return results. This is because there is no initiating \~worker\~ designated until the process has started. The Initiating \~Worker\~ field only gets a value after the event is initiated (after the process is submitted).

overallBusinessProcess_ce00e3198c5b10000.description: Returns the Top Level (overall) Business Process that this Event is part of or returns the same instance if this Event is not a sub-process.

for_ce00e3198c5b1000095ceb1fc8290014.description: The thing which this business process is about. It could be another business process if this is a sub-process

creationDate.description: Date the business process was initiated.

completedDate.description: The date and time the business process was completed.

effectiveDate.description: The date this business process takes effect.

dueDate.description: The date the business process needs to be completed.

subBusinessProcesses.description: Returns other Business Processes (sub-processes) part of this process, including processes multiple levels down.
